moves.2. Bc4: Cochrane develops aggressively, but cuts off a future counter of P-QB4 [which if White can get it in, usually spells trouble for Black in a Sicilian.]
moves.2... e6: Preparing P-Q4, which would gain a tempo on the Bishop.
moves.4. e5: This move creates a beautiful outpost for a Black Knight at Black's KB4.
moves.5... Ng6: Instead of seizing the outpost at KB4, Staunton prefers to double-attack the exposed White KP.
moves.7... g5: Guarding the Knight and setting a trap...
moves.8... d5: This fork admits of only one reply.
moves.9... f5: ...this devastating riposte. White resigns at once. [The Queen's only flight square is K3, but 10 Q-K3 N-N7 ch forks the royals.]
